review: I thought Fire TV was going to be mostly old movies, but it is much more. It was recommended by a Dish TV installer. He said that he had just picked one up and was amazed at how much it contained. The simplistic remote is a HUGE thing in my mind. I have too many remotes doing...I'm not sure other than on, off, and volume. After that, I'm lost. Frankly, when I sit down to watch TV, usually I have had a busy, stressful day. I don't need to get pissed off because I can't figure out how I messed up the TV...AGAIN. The Fire's remote is home, which turns on my TV (though doesn't turn it off or adjust volume, which I thought was odd if it could turn it on...yeah, I'm that non technical), and all I have to do is choose what I want to watch. I am a big PBS fan, and there is a very large amount of that, documentaries, animal shows, and even more brain food. But it has original series. And they are pretty go. Actually better than pretty good. The variety of programing amazed me. I hadn't heard of the Fire until the gentleman said something about it. It is less expensive than cable or satellite by far. Cheaper than the other subscription tv products, AND I get the bonus of free books and music, plus free two day shipping on my Amazon orders! Now that, ladies and gentlemen, for someone who pinches a penny until Lincoln screams, makes the Fire TV more than work the price.I will admit that the programing, in some categories, is a bit small, but I figured that as it progresses, the programing will, hopefully, expand a bit more. It's still in the early stages, so there is hope. Even if not, it is still more than worth it's price. Frankly, for me, it rocks!

Highly recommend this to those who can't stand the garbage on regular television.
